heaviest_rainfall.status: Record-breaking rain fell on 09 November 2025 with a total accumulation of 47.89mm over 144.8 hours and falling at a rate of 24.6mm per hour at times.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 34.3mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 144.8 hours on 09 November 2025, it was characterized by a peak rain intensity of 24.6mm per hour and a total rainfall of 47.89mm.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning activity recorded in a single day is 23, which occurred on 07 September 2025 (since our records began on 11 April 2025).

storm.status: There are no active storms in the area.  The previous storm started on 02 February 2026 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 13 January 2026 and lasted for 22 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 3 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.6.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 0 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is south-westerly (203°).  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: To date, the maximum wind gust recorded is 128.2 mph on 27 January 2026.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The ongoing windy stretch, 3 days and counting started on 02 February 2026 and ranks 9th in length since records started in 23 September 2024.  The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description: Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 3.0°C) and outside temperature (up 2.5°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 1.1 mm).

summary.summary: Inside; anticipate mild and comfortable temperatures. Outside; cold spells are likely. Also, the atmosphere will feel parched and dry and little or no wind. Chance of light rain, partial cloudiness with some periods of sun, and periods of sunshine are expected. The weather may change rapidly and become worse.

washing.phrase: The conditions are favourable for drying your laundry outside right now but, as always, monitor the situation for changes to the weather.
